alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 125 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Anchor Dam, which is also 29 miles northwest of Pavillion, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Anchor Dam around 130 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin
